etymologies: mid 16th century; earliest use found in 2nd Baron Berners (c1467–1533), soldier, diplomat, and translator. From post-classical Latin pontificalibus, ablative of pontificalia, in the phrase in pontificalibus

definitions: The vestments and insignia of a bishop, cardinal, etc.

notes.text: Chiefly in "in his (also their, our,etc.) pontificalibus".
